meanings.definition: To value or esteem too highly
meanings.sent1: She overrates her own abilities and often ends up disappointed.
meanings.sent2: He always overrates his favorite team's chances of winning.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how he overrates his cooking skills, but burns everything he makes.
meanings.sent4: The company overrates its products, claiming they can solve all your problems.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overrates her students' understanding, leading to confusion in class.

meanings.definition: To give too high a rating or estimate to
meanings.sent1: The critic overrates every movie he watches, giving them all perfect scores.
meanings.sent2: Don't overrate the difficulty of the task; it's actually quite simple.
meanings.sent3: She overrates the importance of fashion trends, thinking they define a person's worth.
meanings.sent4: He overrates his car's speed, believing it can outrun any vehicle on the road.
meanings.sent5: The author overrates his own book, claiming it will be a bestseller.
